posts.title: My Life Story
posts.content: I'm a NTU Electrical & Electronic graduate. I graduated in the year 2025 and I specialise in InfoCommunication Engineering.

posts.title: Why I Chose Engineering
posts.content: Growing up, I was always curious about how things worked. Engineering gave me the tools to explore that curiosity and turn it into a meaningful career.

posts.title: Internship at A*STAR
posts.content: During my final year at NTU, I interned at A*STAR where I worked on a 5G signal processing project. It was a rewarding experience that taught me both technical and teamwork skills.

posts.title: Tips for Surviving University
posts.content: University life can be overwhelming. My advice: manage your time well, don't be afraid to ask for help, and find a good study group. Also, never skip meals!

posts.title: My Final Year Project Experience
posts.content: My final year project involved building a smart IoT-based traffic monitoring system. It was challenging but incredibly fulfilling when it worked during the live demo!

posts.title: Career Aspirations After Graduation
posts.content: I'm passionate about working in the tech industry, particularly in areas related to network infrastructure and cybersecurity. I'm currently exploring roles that align with these interests.

posts.title: Joining Hackathons in University
posts.content: One of the best decisions I made during uni was participating in hackathons. They pushed me to learn quickly, work in diverse teams, and solve real-world problems under pressure.

posts.title: Balancing Academics and Social Life
posts.content: University isnâ€™t just about books. I joined a few clubs and made lifelong friends. Balancing fun with studies was tough at first, but I learned how important mental breaks are.
